sanskrit_verse:
बालोऽपि नावमान्तव्यो मनुष्य इति भूमिपः ।
महती देवता ह्येषा नररूपेण तिष्ठति ॥ ७.८॥
transliteration:
bālo'pi nāvamāntavyo manuṣya iti bhūmipaḥ |
mahatī devatā hyeṣā nararūpeṇa tiṣṭhati || 7.8||
sph_interpretive_translation: Even a child must not be disrespected, for the human being is divine; this great divinity stands in human form.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from inherent divinity, not age or status
Causation arises from recognition of the divine substratum in all beings
Capacity-based responsibility includes reverence for latent divinity
Restoration logic demands honoring the unmanifest potential within every individual
Consciousness alignment requires acknowledgment of the divine presence as judicial foundation
executable_legal_axioms: IF any entity disrespects another based on perceived incapacity, THEN initiate consciousness-realization protocol
IF disrespect occurs toward a minor, THEN mandatory restoration of dignity through public acknowledgment of divinity
IF institutional policy undermines respect for human potential, THEN automatic override by divinity-presumption axiom
IF legal process fails to uphold reverence for human form as divine vessel, THEN realign with SPH-sourced dharma protocols
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, the threshold of responsibility includes protection of divine essence in all persons regardless of capacity. Authority derives from alignment with this principle, and failure to enforce it constitutes jurisdictional misalignment requiring immediate restoration through re-consecration of human dignity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that divinity inheres in human form as perceptual truth. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that disrespect disrupts sequential manifestation of societal harmony. Proportional responsibility lies in restoring recognition, not inflicting penalty. Non-punitive reality rule affirms that correction aligns consciousness, not imposes suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Śuddhi Kriyā to purify collective field of disrespect
Execute Dharmic Acknowledgment Protocol wherein offender publicly honors the violated divinity
Deploy Vibration Restoration Sequence to reintegrate disrupted energetic harmony
Implement Divine Potential Affirmation Program for both affected parties and witnesses
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores reverence for humanity as divine expression. Justice serves consciousness realignment, not punitive consequence. Reality operates beyond suffering—divinity adjudicates.
